comments.html: Is the traffic grooming backward-compatible with RFC2549?  Hopefully it can at least help monitor those older links.
comments.name: Brian Knight

comments.html: Oh my, that’s a tough one. While traffic grooming is definitely implementable on RFC 2549-based networks, those networks use a completely different physical domain and the transponders performing avian-to-optical conversion are not available yet.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
I've been hearing of great strides in that optical transponder technology lately, with quad-porro prisms, Advanced Fusion Hybrid quantum transmission, PC-3 phase coating.. and don't forget XTR.

http://www.bushnell.com/products/binoculars/elite/

(note: I do not work for, nor do I endorse any products from, the company referenced by the URL)

They seem ideal for monitoring RFC2549 carrier and non-carrier frames alike. Grooming really isn't too much of a concern, since those frames sort of groom themselves ;)
comments.name: Brian Knight
